bot_settings.welcome_message: Welcome! How can I help you with your volunteering journey today?

main_menu.question: V.Choose a category to see specific questions:

options.text: V.1.1. How do I get started?
options.answer: To get started, register your profile on the SmartLife Foundation Portal and ensure you are also signed up on the official Volunteers.ae platform to participate in their upcoming events.
Anyone residing in the UAE with a valid Emirates ID who is at least 13 years old and registered on Volunteers.ae is eligible to volunteer with the SmartLife Foundation.

International volunteers are absolutely welcome to contribute their skills by registering as a visitor on the Volunteers.ae platform, allowing them to join the SmartLife Foundation in making a meaningful impact during their stay in the UAE.

While most SmartLife Foundation roles are hands-on, you can absolutely contribute remotely by offering digital skills like graphic design, content writing, or social media management through the online registration portal.

You can choose from hands-on roles like teaching Smart English and mentoring, leading SmartFitness sessions, or supporting major events like Smart Idol and Smart Cup. Digital and creative roles are also available for those wishing to help with social media, photography, or administrative support and so much more!

options.text: V.2.2. How do you match roles?
options.answer: We matche you to roles by reviewing the specific skills, interests, and professional background you select during your online registration, then alert you to relevant opportunities via our mobile app or Volunteers.ae based on our current project needs.

options.text: V.2.3. Can I use professional skills?
options.answer: Yes! You can provide pro bono professional services such as legal advice, medical screenings, or business consulting by registering your expertise on the SmartLife Foundation portal to support our specialized community initiatives.

options.text: V.2.4. Do I need prior experience?
options.answer: Prior experience is not required for most general roles, as the SmartLife Foundation welcomes both first-time and regular volunteers and provides all necessary guidance to ensure a rewarding experience.

options.text: V.3.1. How much time is required?
options.answer: The time commitment is entirely flexible, ranging from one-off participation in annual events like Smart Idol to regular weekly sessions for educational programs like Smart English, allowing you to volunteer as much or as little as your schedule permits!

options.text: V.3.2. Can I volunteer on weekends?
options.answer: Yes! Weekends are the most popular time to help out because we schedule majority of our educational workshops and community activities then to ensure both volunteers and workers can attend during their days off.

options.text: V.3.3. Can I take a break?
options.answer: Absolutely! Volunteering is completely flexible, allowing you to take breaks whenever needed and simply sign up for new activities through the SmartLife Foundation portal whenever you're ready to return.

options.text: V.4.1. Where will I be volunteering?
options.answer: You will typically volunteer at designated labor accommodations in areas like Al Quoz, Sonapur, or Jebel Ali, or at public venues and schools across Dubai depending on the specific SmartLife Foundation project you choose.

Volunteers are generally expected to provide their own transportation to and from SmartLife Foundation events, as standard UAE volunteering regulations specify that travel expenses are typically not covered unless specifically noted for a particular opportunity.

options.text: V.5.1. What info do I need?
options.answer: To register, you will need your Emirates ID, a copy of your Passport and Residency Visa, and a profile photo for the SmartLife Foundation portal and the mandatory Volunteers.ae platform.

options.text: V.5.2. How long does it take?
options.answer: Registration takes just a few minutes to complete on both the SmartLife Foundation portal and Volunteers.ae, though it can take a few days for your profile to be officially verified and approved by the Community Development Authority (CDA).

Yes, your information is kept confidential and is only used for official purposes by the SmartLife Foundation and authorized government platforms like Volunteers.ae to manage your participation and ensure compliance with UAE regulations.
Yes, volunteering with the SmartLife Foundation is entirely free, and you would never be asked to pay a fee to participate in any of our official programs or events.
No, volunteering is a voluntary and unpaid activity, meaning you are responsible for your own expenses and will not receive financial reimbursement from the SmartLife Foundation.
No, the SmartLife Foundation does not offer stipends, as volunteering in the UAE is defined as a non-paid service provided for the benefit of the community.
Yes, the SmartLife Foundation provides all necessary orientation and specific project training to ensure you are fully prepared and comfortable in your volunteer role.

options.text: V.7.2. Can I get a certificate?
options.answer: Yes, you will receive a digital certificate for your service, which is officially issued through the Volunteers.ae platform and can be accessed via our SmartLife Foundation app after your hours are verified.

Yes, the SmartLife Foundation offers you a structured SmartBuddy program where you can personally mentor blue-collar workers to help them improve their language skills, digital literacy, and overall career confidence.

options.text: V.8.1. What is the NGO mission?
options.answer: The SmartLife Foundation is dedicated to uplifting the blue-collar worker community in the UAE by providing transformative education, health, and wellness programs that empower individuals to improve their quality of life and reach their full potential.

options.text: V.8.2. How do you ensure ethics?
options.answer: The SmartLife Foundation ensures high ethical standards by requiring all volunteers to adhere to a strict Code of Conduct that prioritizes the dignity and privacy of the blue-collar community while operating under the direct oversight and licensing of the Dubai Community Development Authority (CDA).
You can contact us directly via email at admin@smartlifefoundation.org or by calling +971 600 578 600 and you can also reach out through our official social media channels.

Yes, volunteering is very safe as the SmartLife Foundation operates under strict Community Development Authority (CDA) regulations, ensuring all activities are supervised and conducted in secure, vetted environments.

options.text: V.9.3. How do I report an incident?
options.answer: You should report any incidents immediately to your on-site supervisor or contact the SmartLife Foundation directly via email at admin@smartlifefoundation.org or by calling +971 600 578 600.
